meanings.definition: To remove a ship or spacecraft from a dock.
meanings.sent1: The captain will undock the spaceship from the dock before liftoff.
meanings.sent2: Please undock the boat carefully to avoid any damage to the dock.
meanings.sent3: Why did the spaceship undock itself without permission? It must be feeling rebellious.
meanings.sent4: As the spaceship undocked, it seemed to break free from the constraints of gravity.
meanings.sent5: The loud sound of the ship undocking echoed through the harbor.

meanings.definition: To disconnect a device from a docking station.
meanings.sent1: Remember to undock your phone from the charging station when it's fully charged.
meanings.sent2: It is important to undock the laptop properly to avoid any data loss.
meanings.sent3: The robot undocked itself from the charging station and went on a little adventure.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was undocking herself from the digital world when she unplugged her phone.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut carefully undocked the device, ensuring a smooth disconnection.
